title: Rashida Tlaib
deleted: In March 2019 it was reported by the [[Capital Research Center]] that Tlaib followed an anti-Semitic Instagram, which compared Israel to [[Nazi Germany]], was behind the [[September 11 attacks]], the creation of the [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]], that the "Jewish Agenda" are "...the tools of chaos magic-touse deception, lies, craft, and magic- to obtain the conquest of the gentile world.", along with other statements. When asked for comment no response was given.<ref>{{cite news|https://capitalresearch.org/article/rashida-tlaib-follows-anti-semitic-instagram-page/|title=Rashida Tlaib Follows Anti-Semitic Instagram Page|publisher=Capital Research Center|date=29 July 2019|accessdate=8 March 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://spectator.us/rashida-tlaib-anti-semitic-instagram/|title=Why was Rashida Tlaib following an anti-Semitic Instagram account?|publisher=The Spectator|date=10 March 2019|accessdate=11 September 2020}}</ref>

In January 2019 photos came out showing Tlaib standing next to Abbas Hamideh, co-founder of Al-Awda, who has repeatedly voice support for [[Hezbollah]] and [[Hamas]]. As well in 2009 Hamideh said that Jews were engaged in organ trafficking, along with other anti-Semitic statements.<ref>{{cite news|https://www.stopantisemitism.org/antisemite-of-the-week/antisemite-of-the-week-abbas-hamideh-hezbollahs-1-cheerleader|date=8 September 2019|accessdate=12 September 2020}}</ref>

title: Rashida Tlaib
added: * On November 14, 2019, the House Ethics Committee announced that it is investigating whether Tlaib used congressional campaign money for personal expenses in violation of House rules.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kelly |first1=Caroline |title=House Ethics Committee extends investigations into Tlaib and 3 other lawmakers |url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/15/politics/house-ethics-committee-investigations/index.html |date=November 16, 2019 |accessdate=16 November 2019 |work=CNN}}</ref>

title: Rashida Tlaib
added: * In August 2019, following the decision of Israel to ban them from arriving in the country, Tlaib and fellow rep. Omar retweeted a cartoon by [[Carlos Latuff]], who has been accused of being anti-Semitic. [[The Anti-Defamation League]], Rep. [[Jerry Nadler]], conservative commentator [[Ben Shapiro]], and othe Jewish groups condemned them for sharing it<ref>{{cite news|last=Goldiner |first1=Dave |title=Jerry Nadler condemns ‘vile’ cartoon shared by Rashida Tlaib along with Trump’s ‘disloyal’ Jews jibe

|url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/15/politics/house-ethics-committee-investigations/index.html |date=August 23, 2019 |accessdate=14 September 2020 |work=NYdailynews}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Bandler |first=Aaron |title=ADL, Jewish Groups Criticize Omar, Tlaib for Sharing Anti-Semitic Cartoon

|url=https://jewishjournal.com/news/united-states/303241/jewish-groups-criticize-omar-tlaib-for-sharing-anti-semitic-cartoon/ |date=August 19, 2019 |accessdate=14 September 2020 |work=Jewish Journal}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Tabarovsky |first=Izabella |title=The left can no longer excuse its Anti-Semitism.|url=https://forward.com/opinion/429787/the-left-can-no-longer-excuse-its-anti-semitism// |date=August 19, 2019 |accessdate=14 September 2020 |work=Forward}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Blitzer |first=Ronna |title=Tlaib, Omar share image by artist once celebrated in Iran's Holocaust cartoon contest.|url=https://www.foxnews.com/politics/tlaib-omar-share-image-by-artist-who-once-entered-irans-holocaust-cartoon-contest |date=August 18, 2019 |accessdate=14 September 2020 |work=Fox News}}</ref>

* On November 14, 2019, the House Ethics Committee announced that it is investigating whether Tlaib used congressional campaign money for personal expenses in violation of House rules.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Kelly |first1=Caroline |title=House Ethics Committee extends investigations into Tlaib and 3 other lawmakers |url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/15/politics/house-ethics-committee-investigations/index.html |date=November 16, 2019 |accessdate=16 November 2019 |work=CNN}}</ref>

*In December 2019,[[Simon Wiesenthal Center]] place Tlaib and Omar at #5 on their list of top ten anti-Semites and anti-Semitic incidents citing their support for the [[Boycott, Divestment and Sanctions]] movement and for other events.<ref>{{cite web|title=2019 Top Ten Worst Global Anti-Semitic and Anti-Israel Incidents|url=http://www.wiesenthal.com/assets/pdf/top-ten-anti-semitic.pdf|work=Simon Wiesenthal Center}}</ref>

*In March 2020, Tlaib spoke at a gala for [[American Muslims for Palestine]], which the [[Anti-Defamation League]] says prompts extreme anti-Israel views and provides a cover for antisemitism.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tlaib to address American Muslims for Palestine gala|url=https://www.clevelandjewishnews.com/jns/tlaib-to-address-american-muslims-for-palestine-gala/article_827933ba-9df5-5f28-93e1-e32f35761247.html |date=February 28, 2019 |accessdate=14 September 2020 |work=Cleveland Jewish News}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |Tlaib to Address American Muslims for Palestine Gala|url=https://www.algemeiner.com/2020/03/02/tlaib-to-address-american-muslims-for-palestine-gala/ |date=March 2, 2020 |accessdate=14 September 2020 |work=The Algemeiner}}</ref>

title: Rashida Tlaib
added: * Abortion: Tlaib supports abortion and has criticized what she considers "white men trying to force women to not have the right to seek legal abortions".<ref>{{Cite web|title=Tlaib slams 'draconian, dangerous' anti-abortion bills|url=https://www.pressandguide.com/news/tlaib-slams-draconian-dangerous-anti-abortion-bills/article_db61981c-7b7a-11e9-9768-f7914c532fc5.html|access-date=2020-09-27|website=Press and Guide|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title=Congresswoman Rashida Tlaib|url=https://www.facebook.com/RepRashida/posts/710100922734513|access-date=2020-09-27|website=www.facebook.com|language=en}}</ref> She was endorsed by pro-abortion organization [[NARAL Pro-Choice America|NARAL]].<ref>{{Cite web|date=2018-09-12|title=NARAL Pro-Choice America Endorses Rashida Tlaib for Congress|url=https://www.prochoiceamerica.org/2018/09/12/naral-endorses-rashida-tlaib-for-congress/|access-date=2020-09-27|website=NARAL Pro-Choice America|language=en-US}}</ref>
